channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Could you service an audience of 10 Million+?
item.description: Sometimes when young companies reach a certain level of success, complacency sets in. The culture (subtly) shifts from entrepreneurial to bureaucratic. Thatâ€™s not this client.

item.title: Love independent music? Hipster not a dirty word to you? Drive forward independent music with Perl in London
item.description: Drive forward independent music with Perl in London

item.title: Junior Perl developer needed to help a charity and giving-focused team in Kent, UK
item.description: Get on the road to career growth while making a positive impact for the world

item.title: Perl mentor needed for large and growing team - train the next generation of Perl developers in London
item.description: Can you help guide and grow the experience of junior Perl developers?

item.title: A love-fest of job satisfaction
item.description: What if you had a job you loved, and that job helped other people find jobs they loved?

item.title: European PerlCon 2019
item.description: August 7-9, 2019 Riga, Latvia

item.title: North American Perl Conference 2019
item.description: June 2019 Pittsburgh

item.title: DC Baltimore Perl Workshop 2019
item.description: April 6th, 2019, Silver Spring, Maryland

item.title: 21st German Perl Workshop 2019
item.description: 6th-8th March, 2019, in Munich

item.title: Meet Perl at FOSDEM 2019 in Brussels, Belgium: booth, Saturday dinner
item.description: It is a bit late to report this now, but this is how the scheduling happened. In any case, thanks for maintaining the Perl presence at FOSDEM every year!

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Limit Bitbucket pipelines to specific branches
item.description: Pipelines is the name of the CI SASS solution Bitbucket provides. Here are some configuration tips.

item.title: Deploying to Kubernetes at ZipRecruiter
item.description: Describing a bunch of tools created at ZR and the process for getting an app deployed. There is nothing Perl-specific in this, but it can be very much relevant to anyone doing DevOps related tasks.

item.title: CSV_XS ERROR: 2034 - EIF - Loose unescaped quote @ rec 5 pos 194
item.description: An error and how to fix it.

item.title: Surprising output for the descending range '01'..'-1'
item.description: Because of the flexibility of Perl and the automatic type conversion the range operator has some edge-cases that are probabaly unintended and might go away. brian d foy shows them to us.

item.title: I'm not positive about this...
item.description: How the unary minus operator on strings can make you questions your life choices.

item.title: Maintaining Perl 5 (Tony Cook): December 2018 Grant Report
Writing Extensible Controllers
item.description: Combine the idea of inheritance in Object Oriented Programming with the web.

item.title: Be the first to author a Perl HTTP/3, QUIC, or QPACK library
item.description: A call for a volunteer to implement something new in Perl.

item.title: Bugs!? - static analysis to the rescue
item.description: A few weeks ago Dave Cross wrote about a subtle bug. Now Jonas adds a Perl::Critic policy that together with a CI tool will be able to help you keep the bug out of your code.

item.title: Monthly Report - January
item.description: Once, a long time ago I also wrote similar activity reports, but I think I only did 2 or maybe 3 of them. Seeing how Mohammed stick to these, I wonder if I should start them again. Would this publication help me doing things better or would it just make me nerveous that I have to report to the open Internet that I have failed in some of my plans? Have you tried to follow the footsteps of Mohammad?

item.title: Exploring Type::Tiny Part 7: Creating a Type Library with Type::Library
Full Text Search for ebooks
item.description: Frew took all of his eBooks, converted them to plain text files using Calibre, then loaded the text into an SQLite database in just 7 seconds and voila. He has a full-text search of all of his books.

item.title: Google Summer of Code 2019
item.description: The Perl Foundation is participating in Google Summer of Code again this year. Deadline is today!

item.title: Vienna.pm TechMeet
item.description: What can I say. While many other Perl Monger groups have shut down, the Viennese plan their meeting a year ahead. Including the one when they have grilled camel. I am impressed.

item.title: #393 - Google Summer of Code 2019 - deadline is today!
item.description:
Hi there!

Before you do anything else this week, check out the announcement of TPF about the Google Summer of code.

It says the dead-line is February 4, 2019. which is today. (The GSOC site mentions February 6, 2019., but TPF might need to have some time to put everything together. So go ahead, check it out now!

Then come back, go on reading the newsletter and enjoy your week!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
